1.speaker: LLAMA
1.japanese: {\an8}草ですか いいですねぇ 草
1.english: Grass, huh? Grass is great, isn't it?

2.speaker: PANDA
2.japanese: {\an8}え～ 草より笹のほうがいいよ
2.english: What? Bamboo grass is much better than regular grass.

4.speaker: PENGUIN
4.english: We're not talking about eating it.

7.speaker: LLAMA
7.japanese: みんなで野球をしながら 草を食べるんですよ
7.english: We all eat grass while playing baseball.

9.speaker: SASAKO
9.japanese: 今度 カフェのチームと グリズリーさんのチームで野球をするんだよ
9.english: The café team will be playing baseball against Mr. Grizzly's team soon.

10.speaker: POLAR BEAR
10.japanese: グリズリーくんから 招待状をもらったんだよ

12.speaker: PENGUIN
12.english: That would be Nagoya Castle {\i1}(Nagoya jou){\i0}.

14.speaker: PENGUIN
14.english: That would be a New Year's card {\i1}(nengajou){\i0}.

15.speaker: PENGUIN
15.japanese: 招待状でしょ シロクマくん

16.speaker: POLAR BEAR
16.japanese: うん これこれ ほら

17.speaker: PENGUIN
17.japanese: なんか ちょっと違ってない
17.english: I don't think that's what you think it is.

18.speaker: GRIZZLY
18.japanese: ふれあい野球場にて決闘を申し込む
18.english: I hereby challenge you to a duel at the petting zoo baseball field.

19.speaker: GRIZZLY
19.english: Burn it up! Burn it up! Wow, so you're having a duel.

20.speaker: PENGUIN
20.english: We're talking about a baseball game. Burn it up, Wild Animals!

21.speaker: GRIZZLY
21.japanese: {\an8}炎上 炎上 炎上 炎上
21.english: Burn it up, burn it up! Burn it up, burn it up!

22.speaker: PANDA
22.japanese: ワイルドで かっこいい

23.speaker: POLAR BEAR
23.japanese: 野生の王国って感じだね

24.speaker: POLAR BEAR
24.japanese: ポーラーベアーズはのんびりいくよ
24.english: The Polar Bears are going to take it easy.

26.speaker: PANDA
26.japanese: プロにスカウトされたら どうしよう
26.english: I wonder what I should do if I get scouted to the pros.

27.speaker: PENGUIN
27.japanese: されないから それよりパンダくん
27.english: You won't need to worry about that. More importantly, Panda,

28.speaker: PENGUIN
28.english: you're playing right field, aren't you?

29.speaker: PANDA
29.japanese: レッサーパンダくんが代わってくれたんだよ

30.speaker: PENGUIN
30.japanese: えっ レッサーパンダくん 本当にライトでいいの
30.english: What? Are you sure you're okay with playing right field, Lesser Panda?

32.speaker: LESSER
32.japanese: パンダくんは動物界のヒマワリ
32.english: Panda is the sunflower of the animal world.

33.speaker: LESSER
33.japanese: 僕はひっそりと咲く月見草ですから
33.english: I'm an evening primrose that blooms quietly.

35.speaker: PANDA
35.english: Let's bring it in! I wanted to clean my fan today

36.speaker: HANDA
36.japanese: 今日は 換気扇の掃除したかったのにな～
36.english: since I finally had a day off.

37.speaker: POLAR BEAR
37.japanese: じゃあ よろしくね 半田さん
37.english: We're counting on you, Mr. Handa.

38.speaker: HANDA
38.english: Play ball! You seem rather into it, Mr. Handa.

39.speaker: TIGER
39.japanese: 草食系の球なんか ちょろい ちょろい

40.speaker: LION
40.japanese: 肉食系のパワーを 見せつけてやれ～
40.english: Show 'em what us carnivores are made of!

42.speaker: PANDA
42.english: You won't be able to hit my pitches.

43.speaker: PENGUIN
43.japanese: ダメだよ パンダくん

44.speaker: PENGUIN
44.japanese: バッターのいるほうに投げてよ
44.english: You have to throw towards the batter!

45.speaker: PANDA
45.japanese: あっちに投げたら 打たれちゃうよ
45.english: But if I throw it that way, he'll hit the ball.

48.speaker: PANDA
48.japanese: 打たれてもいいんだね
48.english: So it's okay if they hit the ball?

49.speaker: PENGUIN
49.japanese: 打たれないように投げてよ
49.english: Throw it so they won't hit it.

51.speaker: PENGUIN
51.japanese: いいよ キミはもう下がってて
51.english: Forget it. You can step aside.

55.speaker: PENGUIN
55.japanese: 魔球南極ブリザードで きりきり舞いさせちゃうからね
55.english: I'll stun them with my amazing pitch, the South Pole Blizzard.

56.speaker: GRIZZLY
56.japanese: 炎上 炎上 俺の打球が火をふくぜ
56.english: Burn it up! Burn it up! My ball's on fire!

57.speaker: TIGER
57.japanese: ４人 連続ホームランだぜ
57.english: We just got four home runs in a row!

58.speaker: WOLF
58.japanese: マスター ナイスバッティング

59.speaker: GRIZZLY
59.japanese: よ～し この調子でいくぞ
59.english: All right, let's keep it up!

60.speaker: PANDA
60.japanese: ペンギンさん ナイスピッチング

61.speaker: POLAR BEAR
61.japanese: このままじゃ まずいね

62.speaker: ANTEATER
62.japanese: 魔球 南極ブリザードを 早く投げてください
62.english: Please hurry and throw the amazing pitch, the South Pole Blizzard! You know, I'm much better at water polo than baseball.

63.speaker: POLAR BEAR
63.japanese: ピッチャー 交代ね
63.english: We're switching pitchers. Let's play a good game.

64.speaker: ALLIGATOR
64.japanese: こりゃ またファンシーなやつだぜ

65.speaker: LION
65.japanese: ワイルドにガツンと 打ってっちゃえ
65.english: Get wild and hit it out of the park!

66.speaker: GORILLA
66.japanese: 俺もホームラン続けていくぜ
66.english: I'm going to continue with another home run.

69.speaker: WOLF
69.japanese: どうやって投げてんだ

70.speaker: HANDA
70.japanese: ストライク バッターアウト

71.speaker: HANDA
71.japanese: ストライク バッターアウト

72.speaker: HANDA
72.japanese: ストライク バッターアウト

75.speaker: SASAKO
75.japanese: ペンギンさん 頑張って

76.speaker: PENGUIN
76.japanese: 秘打 ペンギンの湖

77.speaker: GRIZZLY
77.japanese: 余裕でアウトだぜ よっ
77.english: Well, that's an easy out! Safe!

79.speaker: PANDA
79.japanese: ペンギンさん すご～い

81.speaker: GORILLA
81.japanese: 内角攻めでビビらせてやれ
81.english: Throw it to the inside corner and scare the crap out of him.

83.speaker: GORILLA
83.japanese: ビビって振るかと思ったのに
83.english: I thought he'd freak out and swing at it.

87.speaker: HANDA
87.japanese: ボール フォアボール

88.speaker: HANDA
88.japanese: パンダくん フォアボールだよ １塁行って
88.english: That was ball four, Panda. Take your base.

90.speaker: PANDA
90.japanese: ペンギンさん やったよ～

92.speaker: PENGUIN
92.english: Well, he got on base, so I guess it's okay.

94.speaker: POLAR BEAR
94.japanese: 一気に同点に追いつくチャンスだね
94.english: This is our chance to tie up the game.

101.speaker: SASAKO
101.japanese: ペンギンさん ナイスプレー
101.english: Nice play, Mr. Penguin! Left field!

103.speaker: PENGUIN
103.japanese: 試合中に草食べないでよ
103.english: Stop eating grass during the game!

104.speaker: LLAMA
104.japanese: おいしいですよ ペンギンさんも一緒にどうですか
104.english: But it's delicious. Why don't you have some too, Mr. Penguin?

105.speaker: PENGUIN
105.japanese: ご飯食べるの試合終わってからにして
105.english: Could you eat after the game?

106.speaker: ANTEATER
106.japanese: 今度こそホームランです
106.english: This time it's a home run for sure!

108.speaker: PENGUIN
108.japanese: って ご飯はあとにしてって 言ったでしょ
108.english: Hey! I told you to eat later!

109.speaker: LLAMA
109.japanese: 食後のデザートですよ

110.speaker: PENGUIN
110.japanese: デザートもあとにして
110.english: Have your dessert later, too! Strike!

113.speaker: PENGUIN
113.japanese: コアリクイくんも ご飯はあとにして
113.english: You need to hold off on eating, too, Anteater!

114.speaker: PENGUIN
114.japanese: だから デザートもあとにしようよ
114.english: Come on! Eat dessert later! Polar Bear! We can still win with a grand slam!

116.speaker: TIGER
116.english: They have two outs! Just one more out!

117.speaker: SASAKO
117.japanese: ホームラン期待してます
117.english: I hope you get a home run!

118.speaker: MAMA RS
118.english: Make it a walk-off home run! Hold it! We're changing pitchers. Are they bringing out their secret weapon?

121.speaker: GRIZZLY
121.japanese: 俺の炎のストレートで 打ち取ってやるぜ
121.english: I'll strike you out with my flaming straight ball.

124.speaker: MASAKI
124.japanese: ジャックコーヒーって なんだ
124.english: What's...  Jacu coffee?! My name's Masaki.

125.speaker: MASAKI
125.japanese: 師匠のキノボリカンガルーさんのもとで
125.english: I'm currently learning how to roast coffee

126.speaker: MASAKI
126.japanese: コーヒー焙煎士の修業中です
126.english: under my mentor, Mr. Tree Kangaroo.

128.speaker: MAMA RS
128.japanese: これがコーヒーの実よ
128.english: This is a coffee cherry. Huh? It's red.

129.speaker: MASAKI
129.japanese: 赤いじゃん なんで
129.english: Why? Red means that it's completely ripe.

130.speaker: MASAKI
130.japanese: 豆が熟したらこうなるの
130.english: So when it's ripe, it looks like this?

131.speaker: MAMA RS
131.japanese: この赤いコーヒーの実の中にある種がコーヒー豆よ
131.english: The seed within the red cherry is the coffee bean.

132.speaker: MAMA RS
132.japanese: １つの実の中に２つの種が入ってるのよ
132.english: There are two seeds within the cherry. What?!

133.japanese: コーヒー豆って種だったんだ
133.english: So a coffee bean is a seed? I wonder if this kid will make it... That bird sure comes by a lot.

134.speaker: MAMA RS
134.english: That's Mr. Jacu. {Not sure if it's Mr. or Ms...}

135.speaker: MASAKI
135.japanese: ふ～ん ジャクーっていうんだ
135.english: Oh, so his name is Jacu.

137.speaker: MAMA RS
137.japanese: ジャクーさんとお呼びなさい

139.speaker: MAMA RS
139.japanese: 大切なお客様なんだから
139.english: He's a very important client. Mind your manners! I've poured us some coffee, so let's take a break!

140.speaker: MASAKI
140.english: Thanks for the coffee! This tastes different than usual.

141.speaker: MAMA RS
141.japanese: あら 意外と鋭いわね
141.english: My, you're sharper than you look.

142.speaker: MASAKI
142.english: Are the beans from somewhere else?

143.speaker: MAMA RS
143.japanese: いいえ 焙煎が違うだけよ

144.speaker: MASAKI
144.japanese: ずいぶん変わるんだね

145.speaker: MAMA RS
145.english: Of course! The taste of coffee is determined by the roast!

146.speaker: MAMA RS
146.japanese: これを飲み比べてみて

147.speaker: MASAKI
147.japanese: う～ん すっぱくてちょっとえぐい
147.english: It's a little sour and harsh.

148.speaker: MASAKI
148.english: It tastes like a lot of different things...

149.speaker: MASAKI
149.japanese: こっちは苦い でも後味はすっきり
149.english: This one is bitter, but finishes smooth.

150.speaker: MAMA RS
150.japanese: マサキはどっちが好き
150.english: Which one do you like Masaki?

151.speaker: MASAKI
151.japanese: 後味すっきりのほうが好き
151.english: I like the one that finished smooth.

152.speaker: MAMA RS
152.english: That would be the darker roast.

153.speaker: MAMA RS
153.japanese: 最初に飲んだのは 浅煎り
153.english: The first was the light roast.

154.speaker: MAMA RS
154.japanese: ほら 焙煎が浅いから 豆が…
154.english: You see? It wasn't roasted as long...

155.speaker: MASAKI
155.english: ...so the bean is brown. Exactly. And the bean that's been roasted longer is dark like ink.

156.speaker: MASAKI
156.japanese: 焙煎の深さって 焦げ具合のことかぁ
156.english: So the levels of roasting are determined by how burnt the beans are...

157.speaker: MAMA RS
157.japanese: マサキが好きな深煎りは
157.english: Most of the coffee compounds are

158.japanese: コーヒーの成分がほとんど とんでてシンプルな味なの
158.english: gone in the darker roast that you liked, so it produces a simpler taste.

159.speaker: MAMA RS
159.japanese: コーヒー初心者にオススメね
159.english: I recommend it to coffee beginners.

160.speaker: MAMA RS
160.japanese: カフェインも少なくなってるからね
160.english: The caffeine content is lower, too.

161.speaker: MAMA RS
161.japanese: 夜に飲むときは 深煎りにしたほうがいいわ
161.english: If you drink coffee at night, it's better to drink a darker roast.

163.speaker: MASAKI
163.japanese: 深煎りのほうが濃そうなのに
163.english: You'd think the darker roast would be stronger. What kind of coffee do you prefer, Master?

164.speaker: TREE
164.japanese: ジャクーコーヒーなんだな

167.japanese: コーヒーと何か 関係があるんですか
167.english: Does he have something to do with coffee?

168.speaker: MAMA RS
168.japanese: そうよ ジャクーコーヒーっていうのはね
168.english: Yes, he does. Jacu coffee is...

169.speaker: MAMA RS
169.japanese: ジャクーさんがよく熟した コーヒーの実を食べて
169.english: ...the coffee beans collected from Mr. Jacu after he's eaten a fully ripened

170.japanese: フンとして出した種を集めた豆よ

171.speaker: MASAKI
171.japanese: えぇ～ そんなのが おいしいのか～
171.english: What?! That's supposed to be delicious?!

172.speaker: TREE
172.japanese: おいしいんだなぁ これが
172.english: It is quite delicious. A hundred grams costs more than 4,000 yen.

173.speaker: MASAKI
173.english: Seriously?! Why?! It's expensive because it's rare.

174.speaker: MAMA RS
174.japanese: 同じように ジャコウネコのフンから
174.english: Similarly, there are coffee beans collected from the Asian Palm Civet after it's eaten the coffee cherry.

176.speaker: MASAKI
176.japanese: コーヒー 奥深すぎ

178.japanese: まだまだ勉強することが たくさん あるわよ
178.english: You still have much to learn. We'll teach you a lot more,

179.speaker: MAMA RS
179.japanese: しっかり 復習しておきなさい
179.english: so make sure you review everything you've already learned.

181.speaker: MASAKI
181.japanese: あ でも… それなら みんなで コーヒーの実を食べたほうが
181.english: Oh, but wouldn't it be good money if you all ate the coffee cherries then?

183.speaker: MAMA RS
183.japanese: マサキ なかなか 頭いいわね

184.speaker: MASAKI
184.japanese: いや… 冗談ですって

187.speaker: MAMA RS
187.english: We'll make a fortune! Come on!

189.speaker: TREE
189.japanese: 豆を 食べないでほしいんだな
189.english: I'd prefer that you don't eat the beans.

192.speaker: POLAR BEAR
192.japanese: 一郎くんと約束したんだ

195.speaker: POLAR BEAR
195.japanese: 一郎くんは不治の病で入院してるんだ
195.english: Ichiro is in the hospital with an incurable disease.

196.speaker: POLAR BEAR
196.japanese: その一郎くんが 僕のために ホームランを打ってくださいって
196.english: Ichiro said, "Please hit a home run for me.

197.speaker: POLAR BEAR
197.japanese: プロ野球選手のシロクマさんだけが 頼りですって
197.english: I can only count on you, Polar Bear, the professional baseball player." It's starting again...

198.speaker: POLAR BEAR
198.japanese: 僕は約束どおり 今からホームランを打った
198.english: And as promised, I just now hit a home run.

199.speaker: SASAKO
199.japanese: 今から 予言ですかね…
199.english: Just now? I wonder if that's a premonition?

200.speaker: POLAR BEAR
200.japanese: ホームランに勇気をもらった 一郎くんは

201.speaker: POLAR BEAR
201.japanese: その後甲子園で優勝した
201.english: Ichiro would go on to win at Koushien.

202.speaker: LLAMA
202.japanese: 不治の病じゃなかったんですかね
202.english: I thought he had an incurable disease?

203.speaker: POLAR BEAR
203.japanese: そして 今では メジャーリーグで大活躍している
203.english: And currently, he's a star in Major League Baseball.

204.speaker: PENGUIN
204.english: All right, all right. Let's get a move on and continue the game.

205.speaker: POLAR BEAR
205.japanese: 第２話 ダルくんとの約束
205.english: Episode 2: My Promise with Dar. The end! What a great story. Is he trying to get to us mentally?

207.speaker: GRIZZLY
207.japanese: よかったな… 一郎くん
207.english: Thank goodness, Ichiro... Polar Bear, you're the Shakespeare of the 21st century! However,

208.speaker: GRIZZLY
208.japanese: 野球は筋書きのないドラマだぜ
208.english: baseball is a drama without a set plot!

209.speaker: GRIZZLY
209.japanese: お前の筋書きどおりには… いかねえんだよ
209.english: Things won't go as you planned!

213.speaker: TIGER
213.english: You're awesome! How's that? Not bad, Grizzly.

214.speaker: GRIZZLY
214.japanese: このまま 三球三振だ～
214.english: And I'm going to strike you out! Victory beers sure are something else!

215.speaker: PANDA
215.japanese: 勝利の笹も おいしいよ
215.english: The victory bamboo grass is delicious, too.

216.speaker: LLAMA
216.japanese: 勝利の草も おいしいです

218.speaker: LLAMA
218.japanese: しろくまカフェの草は別腹ですから
218.english: I always have room for the grass at Polar Bear's Café.

219.speaker: WOLF
219.japanese: パスタも うまいな

220.speaker: LION
220.japanese: このシャケも案外イケるぜ

223.speaker: GRIZZLY
223.english: Damn it. I'm gonna burn it up!

224.speaker: GRIZZLY
224.japanese: 今日は ガンガン飲むぞ～
224.english: I'm gonna drink my heart out today!

225.speaker: POLAR BEAR
225.japanese: 草野球で負けたくらいで 炎上するなんて
225.english: It's rather childish of you to get all fired up

226.speaker: POLAR BEAR
226.english: over losing a field baseball game.

227.speaker: GRIZZLY
227.japanese: おとなげないのは お前のほうだろ
227.english: You're the one who's childish! Why's that?

229.speaker: GRIZZLY
229.japanese: あんな手で勝ちやがって
229.english: Look how you won the game!

233.speaker: POLAR BEAR
233.japanese: 代打 エゾリスママ

235.speaker: MAMA RS
235.japanese: お… 重いわ… 重いわ… お おも… 重いわ

237.speaker: GRIZZLY
237.japanese: おいおい シロクマ ゲームを捨てたのか
237.english: What the hell, Polar Bear? Are you throwing the game?

238.speaker: GRIZZLY
238.japanese: こんな ちっこいのが 打てるわけねえだろ
238.english: There's no way someone so tiny can hit the ball!

243.speaker: HANDA
243.japanese: ボール フォアボール

244.speaker: ANTEATER
244.english: Awesome! That walk scored us another run!

246.speaker: GRIZZLY
246.japanese: ストライクゾーンが 小さすぎるじゃねえ
246.english: Her strike zone is too small.

247.speaker: GRIZZLY
247.japanese: だが 次は そうはいかないぜ

249.speaker: GRIZZLY
249.english: What?! I'll get it this time...

250.speaker: POLAR BEAR
250.japanese: 代打 エゾリス母ちゃん

252.speaker: POLAR BEAR
252.japanese: 代打 エゾリスおかん

254.speaker: HANDA
254.japanese: ボール フォアボール

256.speaker: GRIZZLY
256.japanese: 卑怯な作戦 使いやがって～

257.speaker: POLAR BEAR
257.japanese: 知的な作戦って言ってよ

260.speaker: SASAKO
260.japanese: まぁまぁ おかわり どうぞ

262.speaker: WOLF
262.japanese: クールダウン クールダウン

263.speaker: PENGUIN
263.japanese: 試合が終われば ノーサイド
263.english: There are no sides after the game is done.

265.speaker: POLAR BEAR
265.japanese: また やろうね グリズリーくん

266.speaker: GRIZZLY
266.japanese: 今度は完全燃焼してやるからな
266.english: Next time, the game will be ours. You better be prepared!

268.speaker: SLOTH
268.japanese: お～ ま～ た～ せ～

270.speaker: SLOTH
270.japanese: はやく～ はじめようよ～

271.speaker: PANDA
271.japanese: ペンギンさん ペンギンさん

272.speaker: PENGUIN
272.english: What is it, Panda? What's that silver thing you put curry into called again?

273.speaker: PENGUIN
273.english: Does it actually have a name? All right, next question.

274.speaker: PENGUIN
274.japanese: 気になるよ 答え教えて

275.speaker: PANDA
275.japanese: 実家に帰ったほうがいいんじゃないかな
275.english: I think you should go back to your parents' house.

276.speaker: PENGUIN
276.japanese: 僕の生き方の答えじゃなくてさあ
276.english: I'm not asking you how I should live my life.

278.speaker: POLAR BEAR
278.japanese: 来週のしろくまカフェは

279.speaker: POLAR BEAR
279.japanese: モールス信号でお送りします
279.english: will be presented to you in Morse code.

280.speaker: PENGUIN
280.english: I don't think they'd get it.
